positive.review:
MiSide is actually a very nice and well made game with a nice Story and a very good Horror Aspect.
It starts very cute and cozy and then turns into different ways. I don't want to spoiler anything but it's a really great game.


Praying for you, O Great Mita

I'm having a lot of fun spending time and playing games with mita
why would anyone want to leave
I can happily just stay here forever

Fun little experience. Wish it was a bit more of a slow burn but also I get that people are impatient these days and want games to get to the point in a hurry. 
Looking forward to Peaceful mode, because I can definitely fix her, trust ðŸ™

A clever, unsettling horror experience that constantly subverts your expectations. The characters are deceptively friendly yet unmistakably eerie, adding a lot of personality to every scare. Tight pacing, great atmosphere, and some genuinely memorable twists. Short but absolutely worth it.

I've completed the game's main story. I appreciate the pleasing visual style, atmosphere, and intriguing storyline. I'd like to learn more about the world's structure and am looking forward to the release of Peaceful Mode.

MiSide surprised me more than I expected. What starts as a cute and cozy experience slowly turns into something strange, emotional, and a little scary. The art and music fit perfectly with that shift, making the story both unsettling and oddly comforting. Itâ€™s short but memorable, with twists that actually mean something. Canâ€™t wait for the next updateâ€”or maybe a sequel.

This is honestly one of the best games I've ever played hands down. I may be biases tho, I mean look at my pfp

I have my reasons for liking it tho, it has a shit ton of minigames and it's obvious the dev's care about their players with the amount of effort they put into each one. I'm excited for what they make in the future.
Awesome game with no horror elements, just a perfect heart warming game with absolutely no jump scares
Great story, amazing character development I should say, my favorite game of 2025.
It's a very good game; if you're in search of a cute horror game to try something out of the ordinary, this is your game. Don't hesitate.

This was surprisingly another good psychological horror game I've played and of course I have not watched or heard about this. Soundtrack is a bop and the mini games/puzzles are fun to playthrough but I'm surprised that they're still planning to add more content with the major being "Peaceful Mode" that I seriously can't wait to try out.


Also Cappie my beloved.

Miside looks cute as hell, but the more you play, the more you realize somethingâ€™s definitely off. Itâ€™s that perfect mix of â€œawwâ€ and â€œoh nah.â€ The atmosphere hits hard, the music fits the vibe, and the mood switches from sweet to creepy super smoothly.

The story gets darker the further you go, the meta stuff is just the right amount, and the art looks greatâ€”some of the twist scenes are actually sick. Puzzles are easy but keep the flow going, so nothing feels dragged out.

The game isnâ€™t long, but it feels satisfying, with multiple endings that make replaying fun.
If you like psychological horror that looks soft on the outside but hits different inside, this is it.

9/10.
10/10 horror game, speaking to a woman was truly a terrifying experience!

Great video game. 
Starts off all cute and cosy, then gets dark. Very dark. But its still cute, even though its kinda scary lol
Story is very well written. Game design is awesome. 
I'm looking forward to playing the Peaceful mode once that releases, and I'll tell ya, I'll be quick to jump right back into playing MiSide! 
I bought at -20%, but it is worth full price. 10/10

Btw this is the same game that probably has a budget of 2 quarters and a vodka bottle, "in a good way", and it ends up being better than the most AAA games.

peak game.

Some people might call the game slop and not  scary but the thing is it is it has women and women are scary so who cares its well made and it has many waifus
KInd mita best mita would recommend 10/10 worth the money

I just finished playing the game after watching it months ago at Corrupted. I'm amazed by the game, and playing it myself was definitely a different experience. The constant malaise paired with a game that, at first glance, could be a dating sim, is great. The minigames were a cool bonus but probably unnecessary. It was funny, though, how Mita waited for us while we finished an arcade racing game. Love the game. Also reminded me of Doki Doki Literature Club.
I beat this in one sitting. It wasnt until the credits rolled I was positive it wasnt a porn game.
I have already played through the entire game three times, and as I write this, I am playing through it for a fourth time.

One of the very few games to keep me interested even during replays. I went into it thinking it was going to be a very basic "evil woman" trope, but it had a lot more depth to it than I was expecting that can really only be elaborated on through playing it yourself.

Absolutely loved it!â€”this game managed to impress me at every turn with its creative mechanics, clever writing, and striking blend of cute visuals and psychological horror. The experience constantly surprised me, offering unexpected twists, varied gameplay, and memorable characters who truly stand out.

MiSide feels less like a tide and more like a confession- my side, my perspective, my fears staring back at me. Even before the game begins, the name alone hints at something personal, unsettling, and oddly inviting. 

This psychological horror gem takes the concept of "mommy" character and spins it into a kaleidoscope of personalities- clones, but each a different shade of the same identity. Beneath the cute veneer and soft colors runs a surprisingly share philosophical undercurrent: escapism, identity, and what happiness even means when the walls of reality start to bend. You don't expect a game that shifts from 2D to 3D- with the sudden realization on the occasional breaking into 4th dimension. 

If you're into adorable anime girls mixed with the oppressive dread of P.T. (yes, there's a level that wears its Silent Hills influence proudly- except the terror comes wrapped in kawaii aesthetics), this game is basically saying, "Welcome home, sweetie."

In short, MiSide pulls off plot twists I genuinely never saw coming. It's a fantastic litmus test for how you, the player, shape the digital world- and how that world quietly shapes you right back. 

Note:
-Game is best enjoyed with headphones and a bowl of Nude noodles

Miside was one of the games that really surpriced me, it was way deeper and versatile than I was expecting it to be.
I love the idea of a pretty girl that hides this dark side to her, so you re not sure if you should be liking her or be scared for your life... 

Great story and characters, lots of minigames, secrets everywhere.

Only downsides really are that theres no controller support, or cloud saves.
Absolutely incredible game with a blend of styles and in-depth story. One of my favorite games of all time now. Highly recommend, you won't be disappointed!

wouldnt say i recommend it, but i wouldnt tell you to avoid it either. the game has some interesting lore, but not too story rich, yes, your choice matters but it would lead you to only 3 endings, from which 1 is still under constraction, that ending will have some bonus lore i suppose, it might be boring but it would turn your game into a sandbox.

as the ending of this review i would rate this game at 7.1/10. game is not too expensive so many people would afford it, if youre into this type of lore you can try this game out. 

have a nice time. peace out.
Underrated game that exists in a world where big corporations with an unlimited budget release the same game each year.

Great characters.
Great story.
Very well made visual effects.
Sprinkles of easter eggs here and there.

I look forward to future updates.
An excellent game chock full of secrets. Its hard to get right, but this is a top notch blend of cute and horrifying.
Really super ultra mega fire game, totally worth the price. Also turned Mita into a R34 Nissan Skyline

Absolutely fantastic. 
This game has so many things going for it, and I can't find one that it has going against it.
And the Devs are still working hard on it as well.

Very good and cozy game.
I want to see what happens if Mita and Monika meet eachother :)
A type of game that i have not played before as a mix of genre, game is done very well and the psychological horror buildup is good.

Fun game! ðŸ©· Finally got to experience what itâ€™s like being a lonely guy simping for an anime waifu who turns out to be psycho.

The gameâ€™s weirdly wholesome and unique, kind of defying the assumption that itâ€™s just gonna be another gooner game (the MC's not even a total creep).

The jump scares were well-timed, and the constant switch between cozy and cursed really built up the spooky atmosphere. I love the tension; getting a mini heart attack during a creepy encounter/chase, then suddenly seeing everything back to normal + meeting another cute Mita, like the gameâ€™s giving you a short breather before throwing you back into the madness

Main puzzles were chill. Some of the mini-games were pain in the ass, though. Trying to perfect them ate up way too much time and reminded me how much of a noob I really am.

Hoping to unlock all the achievements soon! Or maybe Iâ€™ll just rely on a bit of divine intervention:

Praying for you ðŸ•¯ï¸ O Great Mita ðŸ’

A captivating story continuing to prove unpredictable as you trek on. A world filled with a story of its own that's wonderful whimsy, awe inspiring scenes, eerie darks, or all of the above. All while the characters display impressive personalities as they come and go to help you along the way. Or are they?
I love this game a lot and my friends played it so it means its really good game and liek you should buy it cuz its a good game
watched asmon play, thought to myself "this is weird", I couldn't stop playing, then finished the game. Suprisingly good. Simple, but effective gameplay
i was playing with one hand this entire time. when i got to a certain part i knew i was ODIN DIN DIN DONE! definitely recommend this game. would be better 2 hands.

OMFG. I just finished the main story for the first time and that shit was genuinely one of the most fun and creepy games that I've ever played. So much suspense throughout the story and always kept me on my toes. The story is really deep and it goes much further into our corrupted society then meets the eye.
Not life changing good, but a great experience nonetheless, *especially* considering how small of a team made it.

I'm usually not into these kind of games, but i really liked this one. The visuals are great, and the story is pretty good as well, considering the playtime. I hope we get some plus content with the peaceful mode tho.

Also, Sleepy Mita is really cute.
A nice and strange story about a lonely guy, an obsessive android, and a broken fourth wall.

Mita is such amazing and wholesome person. She is strong, beautiful, cooks food alongside you, plays games with you and overall a very positive person. She is perfection incarnate. A genuine Mita/10!

Honestly, I was scared to play this game because I thought my friends were going to judge me. But they played it too, and honestly, we all thought it was a pretty good game. There's more I want to say, but it would just be spoilingâ€”so you're just going to have to play it yourself.
this game was really well done. It's a bit on the short side, but I still really enjoyed it.

MiSide is an engaging, though fairly short, game. Itâ€™s clear the developers put genuine effort into creating a truly unique storyline.

At first glance, the game might seem childlike due to its soft visuals and bright presentation. But that impression is misleading â€” behind the cute aesthetic hides a full-fledged horror experience. You wonâ€™t find the usual outdated streamer clichÃ©s here; the game itself reflects the mundanity and hopelessness of modern life, pressing right on that vulnerable psychological spot.

Despite the characters sharing similar appearances (aside from hair color and small details), each one is carefully written and evokes a real emotional response. The attention to detail is impressive. The gameplay and mechanics are simple, yet feel fresh and unique thanks to their presentation.

I recommend putting aside any preconceptions and playing through the game with focus on its story.
one of my best horror game still waiting for the new update Peaceful mode
hi mita this is a very nice game but the real vearshan is creepy and the oven had a chansaw in it
Amazing game with good potential for replayability! Can't wait for future bigger updates

I love this game! The game and gameplay is amazing, works great and looks really good for the style of the game. I like psychological horror games like this, it really draws you in wanting to show the good, the bad and the crazy of its characters. 
It's insane how good they convey mult different characters in only 'one' character. 
It was fun to play through, unlock the different endings and fun to achievement hunt. 

Cant wait for the next update, "Peaceful Mode"!!!

This is a real game with real effort put into it. I would recommend this if you are into horror games or if you want to get into horror games since it isn't too intense. The story is very engaging with fun and interesting anime girls that are all very distinct despite all being clones or something

Also I hope Tiny Mita is ok, poor thing

It still blows my mind that two Russian dudes got together and decided to create this masterpiece of an adorable, psychological horror game! Such a polished gem that is best experience by playing it yourself. It's one of those game  that I wish I hade the ability to do so. Also, the soundtrack is absolute banger to listen to.

My favorite Mitas are [spoiler] Core Mita, I have a thing for robots [/spoiler] and [spoiler] Mila, she deserves so much better... :( [/spoiler]
adorable game, made my friend play as well. <3 love the vibes for it and the artstyle

One of the few horror games I've played, but its not just a horror game to be scary, which i'm fine with since the story is so well done and the art is so perfectly done that it is worth any creepy feelings I get.

This game is one of the best games I have ever played. It may be the best, it has amazing story and twists. I hope that they update this game for the peaceful update soon though. I would really like to test that out.

Praying for you O Great Mita!
I highly recommend this game. If you are looking for something just as good as Doki Doki but in a FP style 3D game this is for you. It is on the shorter side only taking 4 ish hours to play through. Then to get the other 2 endings it took me not even an hour but I loved every second I spent in this world. The horror elements are very nice and the characters are amazing! I got all of the achievements as well and I'm not someone to 100% a game but I enjoyed this experience so much I wanted to stay in the this world long as I could! 10/10 Simply a masterpiece.
unique and beautiful art style and story. the characters (or some of them :P) are very likeable.

loved playing this game and its really cute but did some twists i wasnt expecting

Is it the best to execute it? yes
this game rules, and the weird kind of 3d effect everything has looks insanely good. has so many little details you probably won't notice unless you know where to look but that just makes it cooler, plus it has a lot of replay values and the best part is you can replay from a specific chapter rather than having to start from the very beginning. very gud game, very cool and nice
The best narratively, tied together game, with different gameplay and concepts, I've ever played. The way the game ends too and goes around... About the best thing I've seen in a while!
A 'horror' game where half the time you wonder why you're even trying to escape because you just want to stay with the Mitas. My only criticism is I wish it could have been 10x longer.

This game feels like it has been forgotten by the time the Game Awards announced their stuff, but in my opinion, itâ€™s definitely one of the best games of the year I had so much fun overall

By this point, you might know that this game has a twist, but it goes way beyond just a simple twist. It has a really fun story with a lot of replay ability, from what I can see. The game has a bunch of minigames that are really fun and serve more than just as filler for the story, the minigames are genuinely enjoyable and have a lot of references, such as Guitar Hero and DOOM

The game also has a great cast of characters, each playing a part that might seem simple at first, but ends up being something more significant than just a skin for a character It really separates all the stories well from a gameplay, visual, and storytelling perspective

Great game, buy ittt

I guarantee you'll love it) In "The loop", however... my game was always crashing after a while... (I'd still recommend getting this game despite this.)

Playing this game very much felt like playing Doki Doki literature for the first time, I mainly was interested to find out why this game had the tag for horror and thought it was honestly going to be bad, but from playing this game I definitely see why it was so popular when it came out.
This game is amazing, It has world with a twist, interesting storyline, characters are unique, Best to go into the game blind like I did.
The story, art style, character and puzzle solving are unrivaled. This game is one of a kind and its a gem!
literally one of the best games ever, its so cute and eerie at the same time

Loved playing this game and have come back to it a couple times to replay certain sections (mainly the Mila section)
Was honestly scary at times and genuinely unsettling. But calm and kinda warm as well. Can't wait to see what Aihasto does next for this game and it's characters.

Make more for Mila please.

Game is cute and sweet, but also scary and throws you into a loop (in more ways than one). MiSide probably the only 3D psychological horror game that I own and for good reason! It reminds me of four other psychological horror games but those are visual novels. It has a lot of minigames and more to come in the future! Can't wait for Peaceful Mode!

This game is cute and extremely varied. It's not afraid to get dark and cutesy. It'll flip on a dime sometimes. The story is well paced and none of it is too hard for casual players to enjoy. It's an impressive labor of love and an amazing passion project from just two guys! I love the different Mitas you can come across.
Ah, MiSide.  Like a 3D DDLC, this game provides you with twists and turns, all sprinkled with our lovely Mita.

To quote Ted Kaczynski; "The industrial revolution and its' consequences have been a disaster for the human race." And it has, we're living in an age where everything kind of sucks and there probably aren't too many generations of the human race left. But, the industrial revolution was not a wholly negative thing. After all, it directly led to society as we know it today, and although we theorize that we would be better off without industry, life as it is now is non-negotiable for almost everyone. There is of course, a much greater benefit of the industrial revolution: You can draw a line from the industrial revolution to the creation of MiSide, which I, for one, believe is worth the death of the climate and eventual extinction of the human animal.
Heard good things about this game when it came out. Played it a year later, was really good. The voice acting and story was very well made. Can't wait for peaceful mode to come out

I enjoyed the story and the graphics
Still waiting on that peaceful mode tho
One of my favorite horror games. I was really surprised with how much there is and how engaging it stays. Blew my expectations away.

MiSide is exceptionally well-made and I appreciate the attention to detail. It does not feel like it was made by a team of two. The animations are smooth, and the game feels very polished. It's honestly a surprise to see a game run without any hiccups in today's age.

The voice acting is superb and really completes the experience. I love the vibrant art style. The story is intriguing and the horror doesn't rely merely on cheap jump scares. The tension builds up well and the scares pay off. It was a short five hour experience but it was enough time to get immersed in the world of MiSide and get invested in all the terrific characters.

I look forward to any future content and future games by the developers.

I love this game. It has a deep story and many secretes to unlock. I also love all of the language options. It's helping me learn Spanish in a fun and engaging way. I love the voices for the Latam version. The characters are all great and memorable too.

MiSide was a breath of (unlike some of its players' B.O.) fresh air. After encountering MiSide memes online and seeing how everyone was claiming how good it was, I decided to pick it up.

This game has it all: innovative gameplay, an amazing soundtrack, great voice acting, and a story that absolutely [b]digs into you[/b]. I can't remember if I bought it on a discount or full price, but either way it's worth every penny.

Such a wonderful experience I've had with this game. I have seen only like few clips but experiencing the whole game by myself was the best. I truly love the game that I had to go and 100% it. One of the best games for me, even if I am late to the party, hehe.

Patiently waiting for the Peaceful Mode to hang out with Mita and having a lovely time together.

love the game as a whole. good scares, gorgeous environments, very immersive in story and characters, fun easter eggs and references, and exceptionally great music of course. i myself enjoy replaying the game every now and then.

I installed MiSide â€œjust to test it for 10 minutes.â€
11 hours later I was questioning my life choices, my reality, and whether my PC is emotionally stable.

Fun! Good story pacing that is full of surprises. I would say while games like Outlast and Silent hill count as horror games, Miside is more of a thriller. So it's perfect for people who want to experience the suspense without having to have trouble sleeping at night.
I just love the game for its unique art style and story

negative.review: It's been nearly a year. Work on Peaceful Mode rather than putting everything into promotion and merch.

This game is an embodiment of everything DDLC sought to criticize. It has the foundations of an interesting story yet  it falls flat on its face because of how Mita is written; this game is for those who merely want to fawn over a yandere type character.

I wish steam had a middle of the road button, that game is good, but there is a lot of extra stuff that is not done, the devs current practices, such as makeing merch and no responce or update on devolpment are starting to make me wonder if they are still working on it, but given there current practices and how much they rely on mingames to keep the game engadeing and only one ending in a game that feels like there should be more than one, I cant recomend it at this time. BUT I TRUELY hope it dose not stay that way

Okay little walking-sim about AI and escapism. Didn't really do it for me with the spooks and refrences. I tried playing along, but the voice acting in english atleast kept having weird cut-offs mid sentence. There's really nothing new or exceptionally well done here that's a must try.

Meh, anime waifu wants to be understood. GladOS wore it better.

I really don't get how this is overwhelmingly positive. The main character is cute and I get the overall idea for the story is a good idea. But it's just a walking sim. There's no branching pathways or decent puzzles. 3-4 hours of gameplay. It's just kind of forgettable.

Honestly, I didn't want to make this review, but given the massive hype around the game, with 100,000 reviews and overwhelmingly positive scores, I feel like I should my piece out there so people don't make the same mistake I made.
I like horror games, quite a bit, most of them I watch people play, but now and then I'll play one myself out of interest or I think it looks cool. I saw this game's reviews and thought it would be cool, unique and interesting. It honestly wasn't any of those things.
The only thing that stood out about this game is the artstyle, cutsy, and anime. Everything else was honestly pretty cliche, and dissatisfying. It felt like I was playing through a horror trope checklist for a fair bit of the game.
The story felt like I was playing DDLC but every character was Mita. The gameplay was a list of different tropes, starting with Backrooms, to PT, to the "don't look away from the enemy or it moves" thing. The soundtrack was uninteresting and honestly, I can't remember if there really is any music in it. I also played the game with English voices, and the voice acting was fine, but for some reason the lines had weird pauses in them.
The game also took quite a bit of time to pick up, and even when it did, I don't think it ever got particularly interesting, The gameplay and puzzles weren't good (and honestly the game held your hand like this was your first horror game) and the story stayed kinda samey and mostly predictable throughout, other than one somewhat interesting thing at the end that ultimately has no bearing on anything else since the game has no satisfying endings.
Honestly, unless you're super into the anime aesthetic, and not a huge horror game person I can't recommend this game to you. This really does feel a lot like a game designed for anime fans who aren't that big into horror, it's not unique, and honestly it's not scary.
Teenager-oriented game with a very fast pacing and no substance. Definitely not for everyone
Extremely overrated, gooner bait game, get a life

you are forced to eat meat in this game. you have to buy mita a soup with dead chicken in them, and later she is cooking the flesh of a chopped up animal in a pan. and you have to eat that! there is no need to normalize hate against animals.

I will change my review when there is a vegan / animal friendly way to play the game.
I almost died from achievements, chill for the masochist

It's been nearly a year. Work on Peaceful Mode rather than putting everything into promotion and merch.

I want to start saying that I acknowledge the developers's hard work and art. It's a very high quality product, it's incredible two guys made this (that's how the story goes)

Having said that, I feel like this is another one of those games that people go bonkers becase, indeed, it's an indie product that only a couple of people did, and the bad ol' AAA corporations would never achieve to do

Just because the art is amazing, it doesn't mean the game is very-very good. I love the start, very creepy, a work of art, but as time goes on, the game starts to become a little bit silly, appealing more to the "waifus" than the story or the horror itself.
Like, don't get me wrong, the girls are GORGEOUS and the artstyle helps a ton, I'm madly in love with Mila and Cappie, but is it really all that it needs to be a great game? Because that's one of the main attractions of the game.

As for horror stops working at a certain point. God, those two minigames where you [spoiler]"play" with Mita[/spoiler] are so stupid and slow.
It all just stops working in a certain point and it becomes a farm for streamers and tiktoks.

As for the endings? Extremely disappointed. Of course, heavy spoilers ahead, but it's not like I'm dropping a bomb here.
[spoiler]The ending where you become a cartridge? I was honestly excited because I thought this was a hald of the game. After all, from the very beginning is clear that to unlock another ending, you need to complete the main story first, right? Well, yeah, it's true, but it doesn't continue the story in any meaningful way, it's just a peaceful mode that hasn't been done yet.
The game really stops caring about the story and horror just to give the mainstream-waifu stuff more views, and goddamn, I hate to admit it, but it marketed the game pretty good.
It just feels very incomplete, the three endings are extremely anti-climatic.
I've heard that they plan to make a new ending where you can save all the Mitas. I'm not aware if this is a official statement but I hope it is. Might as well change my review if they deliver.[/spoiler]

All in all, the game is okay-ish. Not the master-piece people make it to be, but it should get a positive review, or at least a "mixed" one if it existed anyway, right?
Maybe, but my biggest annoyance with this game is that is ANOTHER game being weaponized against AAA games just like Expedition 33 is being weaponized too against them.
I hate AAA corpos just like the next guy, but is it really that enough to lower the bar and give a crown to ANY indie dev that barely does the acceptable job?
7/10, even 6/10 are now treated like 20/10 just because they are okayish and from an indie development, and I'm starting to get sick of it.
Kudos to the devs tho, not for the game itself but for the marketing work. They knew how to sell it and they made it because of it.


TL;DR: Horror and story is only good at the beginning. The rest is heavily carried by "waifu" stuff, "Wow, a DDLC-like game!" and the biggest selling point: It's made by two indie developers, but I guess that one carries it from 7/10 to 11/10 for most people nowadays.
Mila and Cappie are the best girls.

This game is an embodiment of everything DDLC sought to criticize. It has the foundations of an interesting story yet  it falls flat on its face because of how Mita is written; this game is for those who merely want to fawn over a yandere type character.

[b] 5 Point review [/b]

5 pros and 5 cons. Thumbs up or down is just my personal like or dislike of the game.
Pro
[list]
    [*] A great premise with clever use of game logic.
    [*] While all the characters are the same character they did a good job in making them feel unique.
    [*] A fairly short experience even if you want to 100%.
    [*] The community put together voice work is impressive and adds just what this game needed.
    [*] Each section of the game has some unique gameplay keeping it fresh from start to finish.
[/list]
Con
[list]
    [*] While there is promised content and other updates, releasing without controller support hurts this too much. This feels even more apparent given how clunky the controls feel.
    [*] The beginning pacing feels far too disjointed and does very little to build up anything.
    [*] 100%ing the game requires side activities that don't really offer much to the story or world.
    [*] No hard save feature is an odd choice. If you quit before another chapter starts you will have to redo the chapter you are on.
    [*] Taking away control options till they are relevant again feels awful namely running which further leads to the clunky feeling.
[/list]

Okay little walking-sim about AI and escapism. Didn't really do it for me with the spooks and refrences. I tried playing along, but the voice acting in english atleast kept having weird cut-offs mid sentence. There's really nothing new or exceptionally well done here that's a must try.

Meh, anime waifu wants to be understood. GladOS wore it better.

I wish steam had a middle of the road button, that game is good, but there is a lot of extra stuff that is not done, the devs current practices, such as makeing merch and no responce or update on devolpment are starting to make me wonder if they are still working on it, but given there current practices and how much they rely on mingames to keep the game engadeing and only one ending in a game that feels like there should be more than one, I cant recomend it at this time. BUT I TRUELY hope it dose not stay that way

Disappointing game that lacks substance. Has an intriguing premise that the game does nothing meaningful with. You'd think a game about a game would use its medium in creative ways to tell its story, but it doesn't. Instead you're made to do menial tasks and walk through "creepy" (YMMV) settings while the voice acting does all the heavy lifting.

Despite the game being about 7 hours long, the story goes nowhere. You start with a yandere going after you, you end with a yandere still going after you. Her motives, how she captured you, the inner workings of this entire system; none of this is answered or hinted at. The "video game" setting exists purely for imagery's sake.

Only thing I can praise about this game is that it's production value is good. Animations are great, voice acting is great, and the presentation is gorgeous. But the gameplay is equivalent to a Unity tech demo with an anime girl following you around.

I really don't get how this is overwhelmingly positive. The main character is cute and I get the overall idea for the story is a good idea. But it's just a walking sim. There's no branching pathways or decent puzzles. 3-4 hours of gameplay. It's just kind of forgettable.

Honestly, I didn't want to make this review, but given the massive hype around the game, with 100,000 reviews and overwhelmingly positive scores, I feel like I should my piece out there so people don't make the same mistake I made.
I like horror games, quite a bit, most of them I watch people play, but now and then I'll play one myself out of interest or I think it looks cool. I saw this game's reviews and thought it would be cool, unique and interesting. It honestly wasn't any of those things.
The only thing that stood out about this game is the artstyle, cutsy, and anime. Everything else was honestly pretty cliche, and dissatisfying. It felt like I was playing through a horror trope checklist for a fair bit of the game.
The story felt like I was playing DDLC but every character was Mita. The gameplay was a list of different tropes, starting with Backrooms, to PT, to the "don't look away from the enemy or it moves" thing. The soundtrack was uninteresting and honestly, I can't remember if there really is any music in it. I also played the game with English voices, and the voice acting was fine, but for some reason the lines had weird pauses in them.
The game also took quite a bit of time to pick up, and even when it did, I don't think it ever got particularly interesting, The gameplay and puzzles weren't good (and honestly the game held your hand like this was your first horror game) and the story stayed kinda samey and mostly predictable throughout, other than one somewhat interesting thing at the end that ultimately has no bearing on anything else since the game has no satisfying endings.
Honestly, unless you're super into the anime aesthetic, and not a huge horror game person I can't recommend this game to you. This really does feel a lot like a game designed for anime fans who aren't that big into horror, it's not unique, and honestly it's not scary.
Teenager-oriented game with a very fast pacing and no substance. Definitely not for everyone
Extremely overrated, gooner bait game, get a life
